stanza.line: Weary with toil I haste me to my (a)bed(/a)
The dear respose for limbs with travel (b)tired(/b)
But then begins a journey in my (a)head(/a)
To work my mind when body's work's (b)expired(/b)
For then my thoughts (from far where I (c)abide)(/c)
And keep my drooping eyelids open (c)wide(/c)
Looking on darkness which the blind do (d)see(/d)
Presents thy shadow to my sightless (f)view(/f)
Which like a jewel (hung in ghastly (e)night)(/e)
Makes black night beauteous and her old face (f)new(/f)
Lo thus by day my limbs by night my (g)mind(/g)
For thee and for my self no quiet (g)find(/g)
